Read About Our Record GrowthTake a TourApply Now Information for: Current Students Faculty & Staff Alumni & Friends Parents & Family Community & Visitors We're here for you. UNT is more than a university. It s your home away from home. Here, you are surrounded by supportive faculty and staff who inspire you, support you and help you succeed in your studies and in your career. From the current students we know and love, to the future students we can t wait to meet, We Are the Mean Green Family. Let s Get Connected, Eagles. Freshmen Transfers Grad Students International Students Online Students Apply Now https://www.unt.edu/sites/default/files/21_0409_go-center0089_promo_.jpg Terry Scholars Submit your application by Dec. 16! The Terry Scholarship is a four-year scholarship for incoming freshmen. To be eligible, freshmen must have their FAFSA completed, hold a minimum 3.5 GPA and have a record of leadership. Application deadline for the scholarship is Dec. 16. More information https://www.unt.edu/sites/default/files/21_0080_bluebonnet-battle-flag0057_promo_.jpg Apply now for Spring 2023! Are you ready for a college experience that s one of a kind? At UNT you can explore your passions, find your place and achieve your dreams. We're excited you want to be part of the Mean Green Family and we are committed to doing everything we can to get you in your first classes at UNT this Fall. Learn More About the Admissions Process https://www.unt.edu/sites/default/files/scrappy-andy-warhol_promo.jpg Spring Registration Make your spring schedule pop! Registration for Spring 2023 is now open! Register now to make your semester a work of art. Register Now https://www.unt.edu/sites/default/files/18_0367_orientation051_mobile_0.jpg Register for Spring Orientation! Register now to take flight next semester Orientation is a time for you to learn about campus resources, receive academic advising in preparation for registering for classes and learn about UNT's traditions! How to register for orientation With 113 bachelor's, 94 master's and 37 doctoral degrees, it's no wonder UNT is the leading university in the North Texas region. Search our majors, degrees and programs... Degree search Browse Undergraduate Browse Graduate Explore our 14 Colleges and Schools Explore now Schedule a Tour of our beautiful campus Schedule a tour Apply Now to join our Mean Green family Apply now UNT at Frisco plans underway In partnership with the City of Frisco, the University of North Texas is developing a 100-acre site known as UNT at Frisco. This new location, an extension of UNT in Denton and the current Frisco locations, will expand educational opportunities in the North Texas region now and into the future, giving students the convenience of multiple locations, in person and online courses. Construction is underway and is anticipated to open with 27 undergraduate and master s level degree programs. Learn More About UNT's Location in Frisco @UNTSocial Exclusive Oklahoma Tuition Rate #UNTproud Join UNT's private app on Facebook "I was so happy to be face to face with an incoming orientation session today! Class of '22, '23, '24 transfers, welcome to the #MeanGreen family." @UNTPrez UNT at Frisco.Explore degree options. Follow @UNTUnion for updates and events. Campus Life at UNT Frisco startup gets FDA approval on COVID breathalyzer after teaming up with UNT researcher The University of North Texas has received notice that its licensed technology to InspectIR Systems, of Frisco, Texas, has been granted Food and Drug Administration Emergency Use Authorization (EUA) for use as a breathalyzer detection for SARS-CoV-2 (COVID-19). This important approval provides a faster, easier and highly accurate method for detection of COVID-19. This is the first UNT-sourced intellectual property to receive FDA approval, marking a significant milestone for UNT as a Tier One research university. Full Story More UNT News UNT partners with Podium Education for global tech experiential training The University of North Texas is partnering with leading experiential education company Podium Education to provide undergraduate students with in-demand skills for the modern workforce. Students who enroll in the UNT Global Tech Experience will collaborate with students from around the world on applied projects from companies such as Netflix, Spotify, and AirBnB. Full Story More UNT News UNT engineering and logistics researchers receive NASA High-Volume Manufacturing and Supply Chain Management grant Drone deliveries of foods and medications are being piloted across the country, including in North Texas. Packages of all types will be dropped at local residences soon. Researchers with UNT s Center for Integrated Intelligent Mobility Systems (CIIMS) are working with NASA to address some of the challenges to widespread adoption of these innovations. Full Story More UNT News UNT M.P.A. programs named top 20 nationally in new rankings The Master of Public Administration (M.P.A.) program with specialties in two areas in the University of North Texas College of Health and Public Service has been named in the top 20 nationally once again, according to U.S. News & World Report s 2023 Best Graduate Schools rankings. Full Story More UNT News UNT researcher says graphic novels could be valuable tool to improve health literacy A University of North Texas researcher is studying whether graphic novels can be used as a medium to improve health literacy among a variety of populations. UNT is more than a university. It s your home away from home. Here, you are surrounded by supportive faculty and staff who inspire you, support you and help you succeed in your studies and in your career. From the current students we know and love, to the future students we can t wait to meet, We Are the Mean Green Family. Let s Get Connected, Eagles. Freshmen Transfers Grad Students International Students Online Students Apply Now https://www.unt.edu/sites/default/files/21_0409_go-center0089_promo_.jpg Terry Scholars Submit your application by Dec. 16! The Terry Scholarship is a four-year scholarship for incoming freshmen. To be eligible, freshmen must have their FAFSA completed, hold a minimum 3.5 GPA and have a record of leadership. Application deadline for the scholarship is Dec. 16. More information https://www.unt.edu/sites/default/files/21_0080_bluebonnet-battle-flag0057_promo_.jpg Apply now for Spring 2023! Are you ready for a college experience that s one of a kind? At UNT you can explore your passions, find your place and achieve your dreams. We're excited you want to be part of the Mean Green Family and we are committed to doing everything we can to get you in your first classes at UNT this Fall. This new location, an extension of UNT in Denton and the current Frisco locations, will expand educational opportunities in the North Texas region now and into the future, giving students the convenience of multiple locations, in person and online courses. Construction is underway and is anticipated to open with 27 undergraduate and master s level degree programs. Campus Life at UNT Frisco startup gets FDA approval on COVID breathalyzer after teaming up with UNT researcher The University of North Texas has received notice that its licensed technology to InspectIR Systems, of Frisco, Texas, has been granted Food and Drug Administration Emergency Use Authorization (EUA) for use as a breathalyzer detection for SARS-CoV-2 (COVID-19). This important approval provides a faster, easier and highly accurate method for detection of COVID-19. This is the first UNT-sourced intellectual property to receive FDA approval, marking a significant milestone for UNT as a Tier One research university. Full Story More UNT News UNT partners with Podium Education for global tech experiential training The University of North Texas is partnering with leading experiential education company Podium Education to provide undergraduate students with in-demand skills for the modern workforce. Students who enroll in the UNT Global Tech Experience will collaborate with students from around the world on applied projects from companies such as Netflix, Spotify, and AirBnB. Full Story More UNT News UNT engineering and logistics researchers receive NASA High-Volume Manufacturing and Supply Chain Management grant Drone deliveries of foods and medications are being piloted across the country, including in North Texas. Packages of all types will be dropped at local residences soon. Researchers with UNT s Center for Integrated Intelligent Mobility Systems (CIIMS) are working with NASA to address some of the challenges to widespread adoption of these innovations. Full Story More UNT News UNT M.P.A. programs named top 20 nationally in new rankings The Master of Public Administration (M.P.A.) program with specialties in two areas in the University of North Texas College of Health and Public Service has been named in the top 20 nationally once again, according to U.S. News & World Report s 2023 Best Graduate Schools rankings. Full Story More UNT News UNT researcher says graphic novels could be valuable tool to improve health literacy A University of North Texas researcher is studying whether graphic novels can be used as a medium to improve health literacy among a variety of populations. UNT Mobile | UNT Mobile App Skip to main content UNT Mobile App Call us Contact Us UNT Map HomeQuicklinks Back MyUNT Blackboard EagleConnect University Directory UNT Map Jobs at UNT UNT Mobile App MyUNT Blackboard EagleConnect UNT Directory UNT Map Jobs at UNT Home MyUNT Blackboard EagleConnect UNT Directory UNT Map Jobs at UNT Home UNT Mobile App Download UNT'smobile app! Access everything you needfrom UNT while you're on the go. Check out UNT s mobile app! Our mobile app was built from the ground up with busy students (and future students) in mind. Now, you can access everything you need from UNT while you are on the go. Get your grades, find your classes, learn about university events and contact faculty members all with a few swipes and taps. We ll continue to add new features this year! Features for current students: Get final grade notifications more quickly Read the latest UNT headlines with What s New Get your own To dos about specific actions you need to do Check to see if there are any "Holds" on your account Use My Classes to see a list of the classes you re currently enrolled in and save the dates and times to your calendar Use Maps to find your classes See where your bus is using the "Bus Tracker" Use the Directory to learn how to contact your professors Find your Final Exams schedule each semester See today s, this week s, this weekend s or this month s Calendar for upcoming deadlines and holidays Check out Social for a look at what s happening on the best social channels across campus Learn about UNT s Traditions Features coming for current students: Get notified when you can register for classes Register for classes View and get notifications about wait-listed classes Get payment due reminders Pay your tuition and other university bills Update your emergency contact information Features for our future students: Read the latest UNT headlines with What s New Get information about UNT Admissions See your list of To Dos to stay on track to apply or enroll Check out our Course Catalog to see what courses UNT offers Learn about all the ways we can help you pay for college Search for specific classes with the app s Class Search See today s, this week s, this weekend s or this month s Calendar for events and important dates Get familiar with campus before you get here with the app s Maps feature Sign up to Take a Tour of campus Read the latest UNT Sports headlines Request more information about UNT Learn about UNT s Traditions Features coming for future students: View your admissions status Accept admittance Need Help?Contact the UNT This new location, an extension of UNT in Denton and the current Frisco locations, will expand educational opportunities in the North Texas region now and into the future, giving students the convenience of multiple locations, in person and online courses. Construction is underway and is anticipated to open with 27 undergraduate and master s level degree programs. Campus Life at UNT Frisco startup gets FDA approval on COVID breathalyzer after teaming up with UNT researcher The University of North Texas has received notice that its licensed technology to InspectIR Systems, of Frisco, Texas, has been granted Food and Drug Administration Emergency Use Authorization (EUA) for use as a breathalyzer detection for SARS-CoV-2 (COVID-19). This important approval provides a faster, easier and highly accurate method for detection of COVID-19. This is the first UNT-sourced intellectual property to receive FDA approval, marking a significant milestone for UNT as a Tier One research university. Full Story More UNT News UNT partners with Podium Education for global tech experiential training The University of North Texas is partnering with leading experiential education company Podium Education to provide undergraduate students with in-demand skills for the modern workforce. Students who enroll in the UNT Global Tech Experience will collaborate with students from around the world on applied projects from companies such as Netflix, Spotify, and AirBnB. Full Story More UNT News UNT engineering and logistics researchers receive NASA High-Volume Manufacturing and Supply Chain Management grant Drone deliveries of foods and medications are being piloted across the country, including in North Texas. Packages of all types will be dropped at local residences soon. Researchers with UNT s Center for Integrated Intelligent Mobility Systems (CIIMS) are working with NASA to address some of the challenges to widespread adoption of these innovations.
